alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County; Upper Tularosa Valley; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 3:51AM MST until February 03 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches except between 8 and 14 inches in the Sacramento and Capitan Mountains of Lincoln County. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, northeast, southeast, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...Until Noon MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Check road conditions before heading out. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills are expected tonight into Thursday morning. Wind chill values between 0 and -10 are likely.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
